TopicTitle: How to download Kerbal Space Program's 3D files ?

Articles.Content:
Hello ! I would like to know if it's possible to download KSP's 3D files to make a movie (with Cinema 4D, for example) and if yes, what is the steps to do it ?

Thank you !

While the models aren't easy to get at directly, there is a mod to export them to blender. (Not sure it works 100% in 1.0.x)

You can then probably take the models from blender and do as you wish. No idea about copyright issues though.

- Sam

-Edit-

Here's the link:right here

Edited October 7, 2015 by sam.johnson841

You have KSP.

You have all the files.

You have KSP.

You have all the files.

Actually the files are in a KSP-only .mu format, I think. So they have to be exported with a tool.

There is a mu exporter and the ksptoblender importer has a lot of manual tweaking and no fairings at all. Still just have a look at ehnsolios (spelling) render thread to se what can be done.

You can also do a lot of easy moviemaking in ksp itself with camera tools and kerbcam

Actually the files are in a KSP-only .mu format, I think. So they have to be exported with a tool.

But not downloaded, which was the question.
Your thread has been moved to the Fanworks subforum, where the movie-makers hang around, and might be able to guide you.
Actually the models exist in the files, if that is what you are asking. The tools might be, and you can find some with a google search.
Think Sam got you pointed in the right direction but I'd be happy to help with the process if you get stuck. Can't wait to see what you come up with! Welcome to the forums
OK, thank you very much for all your replies !
